name: wheat stitch™ nesting baskets
notes:
looking for a fun and functional way to add color and texture to your home? the **wheat stitch™ nesting baskets** are the perfect solution! this set of four beautifully designed baskets showcases the elegant *[wheat stitch™][1]*, creating a unique, eye-catching texture. made with *bulky weight yarn*, these baskets have a sturdy, durable fabric that holds its shape while keeping your space stylishly organized. whether you're storing craft supplies, toys, or everyday essentials, these baskets bring both charm and practicality to any room.

the basket begins with a circular base, crocheted in the round and set aside. the body is worked flat and then joined to form the basket’s shape. next, the body is slip-stitched to the base for a seamless connection. finally, the basket is completed with a top trim and sturdy handles.

a video tutorial is included with the pattern.

crochet hook: 
[j (6.0mm) - or size to meet gauge][2]

notions:
[removable stitch markers (5)][3]
[yarn needle to weave in ends][4]
[scissors][5]
[blocking mats][6]
[blocking combs][7]
[steamer][8]

optional wooden circles for a flat sturdy bottom:
[7 inch][9]
[8 inch][10]
[9 inch][11]
[10 inch][12]

yarn:
[lion brand hue & me][13]
80% acrylic, 20% wool, 137yds/125g

or

[mary maxim titan][14]
100% acrylic, 80yds/85g
weight: 5 bulky

yardage:
170 (192, 225, 320) yds
yardage listed is per basket. to make all 4 baskets, total yardage is approximately 910yds.

yarn substitutions:
[lion brand thick & quick][15]
80% acrylic, 20% wool, 106yds/170g

[wecrochet brava bulky][16]
100% premium acrylic, 136yds/100g

abbreviations:
blo - back loop only
ch(s) - chain(s)
dc - double crochet
[fsc - foundation single crochet][17]
rs - right side
sc - single crochet
sl st - slip stitch
st(s) - stitch(es)
[stsc - stacked single crochet][18]
ws - wrong side

gauge:
11 sts and 9 rows = 4" by 4"  in stitch pattern repeat rows 3-6, not blocked.

not sure what gauge is? check out this blog post: [what is crochet gauge and how to fix it][19]

sizes:
small (medium, large, extra large)
a (height): 6 (6.5, 7, 7.5)"
b (diameter): 7 (8, 9, 10)"
c (circumference): 22 (25, 28.25, 31.5)"

skill level:
intermediate
